definition: to clap one's hands/to clap each other's hands/high five
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.chinese: 他們相互舉手擊掌互致敬意。

sentences.english: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
sentences.chinese: 在鄰舍面前擊掌作保，乃是無知的人。

sentences.english: It is senseless to give a pledge, to become surety for a neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 在鄰居面前擊掌作保，乃是無知的人。

sentences.english: A foolish man will clap hands, when he is surety for his friend.
sentences.chinese: 常爲人擊掌作保，實是個無知之徒。

sentences.english: Do not be a man who strikes hands in pledge or puts up security for debts;
sentences.chinese: 不要與人擊掌，不要爲欠債的作保。

sentences.english: Next time you hear some good news, give somebody a high-five.
sentences.chinese: 下一次你聽到好消息的時候，跟某人舉手擊掌吧。

sentences.english: High fives and celebrations break out once troops cross the line.
sentences.chinese: 在部隊越過邊境時人們都擊掌慶祝。

sentences.english: He even exchanged high-fives with the competition.
sentences.chinese: 這句話是說，他甚至還和對手擊掌來慶賀。

sentences.english: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
sentences.chinese: 不要與人擊掌，不要爲欠債的作保。

sentences.english: Do not be one of those who give pledges, who become surety for debts.
sentences.chinese: 不要與人擊掌，不要爲欠債的作保。

sentences.english: Hence, she gives a long whistle 1 later the layer afterward layer shot Zhang delayed with wood.
sentences.chinese: 於是，她這邊在與木延的重重擊掌之後長嘯一聲。

sentences.english: By now the Anxiety Brothers are high-fiving each other.
sentences.chinese: 而此時焦慮兄弟卻在互相擊掌慶祝。

definition: to know each other/to recognize/to identify/to acknowledge (an old relationship)
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
